DIV1.HEAD: QUESTIONES BY-TWENE THE MAISTER OF OXENFORD AND HIS CLERKE.
Aus MS. Harl. 1304. Eine theilweise gekürzte version in MS. Lansdowne 762 findet sich ab∣gedruckt in Wülcker's Altengl. lesebuch II p. 191-194.

SP.SPEAKER: Clerk:
SP.P: Sei me, where was god whanne he made heven and erthe?

SP.SPEAKER: Maister:
SP.P: I sey the, in the forthere ende of the wynde.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Telle me þat word þat god firste spake.

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Be þe(r) made liȝt, and light was made.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whi is heven clepid heven?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: For the heven coueryth all þat is vnder hym.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: What is God?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: He is god þat alle thynge made & alle thynge hathe in his powere.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: In how fele dayes made god alle thynge?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: In six dayes: the first day he made lightnes & light.
The seconde day he made alle thinge þat helden þe heven,
The thirde day he made water and erthe,
The IIIIth day he made the fyrma∣ment of heven,
The fifte day he made the sterres,

The six day he made alle-maner
bestis, fowlis & fysshes in þe see, & Adam þe first man.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Wherof was Adam made?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Of VIIIte thinges weyghtis weyande: the fyrst weyght is erthe,
The secounde is fyre,
The thirde is wynde,
The IIIIte is clowdes,
The fifte is ayere, wherthorow he spekyith & thynkyth,
The sixte dew, wherthorow he sweth,
The sevent is of flowres, wheroff Adam hath his yeen,
The VIIIte is salte, wheroff Adam hath salt teris.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Wheroff was fownde þe name of Adam?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Of fowre sterris; þeis ben þer names: Arax, Bux, Arstolem, Comfunbrie.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Of what state was Adam whan he was made?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: A man of XXX wynter age.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: And of what lengith was Adam?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Of fowre-score and of VI enchen.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: How lon̄ge leued Adam in this world?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: IXC and XXX wynter, & afterward in helle, & was to-geþer .... Die zahl ist mir nicht leserlich.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Of what age was Adam whan he begate his first childe?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: An C & XXX wynter, & hade a son þat hight Seth. & Seth leued IXC wynter & XXXti. And þat Seth had a son þat hight Enos, and Enos lyued IXC wynter & V. And þat Enos had a son þat hight Canaan, & Canaan lyued IXC wynter & X wynter, & had a son þat hight Malek. & þat Malek lyued IXC & V wynter, & had a son þat hight Jared. & þat Jared lyued IXC XLII wynter, & had a son þat hight Matusale. & þat Matusale lyued IXC XLIX wynter, & had a son þat hight Lamec. & Lamek lyued VIIC XLVII wynter, and had a son þat hight Noe. & Noe lyued IXC & XL wynter, and had thre sonnes: Sem, Cam & Japheth. & Sem hadde XXXti children, & Cam XXX children, & Japheth XII children; & so fele langages weren.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: What was he þat neuer was bore & was buried in his modur wombe & sithe was cristened and saued?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: That was owre fadur Adam.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: How longe was Adam in paradise?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Seven yere, and att seven yeris ende he trespased ageyns god for the appell þat he yete on a friday, and an angell drofe hym owte.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: How fele wynter was Adam whan owre lord was don on the crosse?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: That was VMCC & XXXII yere.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: What hight Noes wyff?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Ballida; and the wiff of Sem Ca∣teslima; and the wiff of Cam Laterecta; and the wiff of Japheth Aurea & oþer thre names Ollia, Olina & Olibana.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Where-of was made Noe is shippe?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Of a tree þat is clepid chy.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: And what lengith was Noes shippe?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Fyfty fadom of brede, CC fadom of lengith, & XXXti fadom of highnes.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: How fele wynter was Noes shippe in makyng?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Fowre-score wynter.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: How longe durid Noes is flood?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: XL dayes and XL nyghtis.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: How fele children had Adam & Eue?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: XXXti gromes and XXXti maidens.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Hoo made the first Citees?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Enos, Seth is son, & the Citee hight Ninimen. & þer were þer-in XIIC & XXM Cheueteynes, with-owten women, with-owte bachi∣lers & with-owte children. And whan Noe is flood was awey, thai made Jerusalem.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: What Cite is there the son gooth to reste?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: A cite þat is clepid Garica.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whiche ben the beste Erbis þat god loued?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: The Rose and the Lylye.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whech foule loued god best?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: The Coluer, for god sent his spirit from heven in lykens of a coluere.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whiche is the beste water þat euer was?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Flom Jordan, for god was baptiȝed þer-ynne.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Where becom thangels þat god put owte of heven & bycom develen?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: In thre parties were þei partid: some in to hell, & some regnen in the skye, and som in waters and in wodis.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: How fele wateris ben there?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Twey salte waterys and II fresshe waers.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Hoo made firste plowes?

SP.SPEAKER: M.
SP.P: Cam, Noes son.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whi berith not stones frute as well as tres?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: For Caym slough Abell with an asse chekebon.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whiche is the best thynge & the worst amonge men?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Worde is best and worst.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Of what thynge be men most sekere?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Men ben most sekyre of deth.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whiche ar the IIII thynges þat man may not leve with-owte?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Wynde and fyere, water and erthe.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Where resteth a man is soule whan þat he slepith?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: In thre steedis: in the brayn, or in the blood, or in the herte.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Telle me why that the see is salte?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: For the wordes þat god commanded to Moyses & for the children of Israell þat wold not kepe þer lay, Moyses brake the Tables and threw þem in the see, and teres felle owte of þem.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Telle me þoo ten wordis and þer names.

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: The first word: honowre no god but me, for I made heven & erthe.
The secound is: clepe me nought in vayn thynge.
The third is: kepe þi sonday, for þat is my day.
The fourth is: honour thi fadur and modur.
The fifte is: slee no man with wronge.
The sixte is: vse no leccherie.
The sevente is: take non oþer mannes good with wronge.
The VIIIte is: bere no fals wytnes.
The IX is: lat oþer men hafe þer own goodis.
The X is: couet non oþer mannes wyff.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Where lith Moyses body?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Besides the howse þat is clepid Eufegor.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whi is the erthe cursed & the see blessid?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: For Noe and Abraham, & for cristen∣ynge þat god commanded.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whoo sett fyrst vynes?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Noe sett the first vynes.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Who clepid first god?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: The devell.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whiche is the heuyest thynge ber∣ynge?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Synne is the heviest.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whiche thinge is þat som louen & som haton?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: That is Jugement.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whech be the foure thynges þat neuer were full ne neuer shall?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: The first is erthe, the second is fyre, þe thyrde is hell, þe fourte is a couetous man.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: How fele maners ben þer of fleande brides, & how fele fysshes?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Foure & fifty of fowles, XXXVI of fysshes.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whiche was the fyrst clerk þat euer was?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Elyas & Elyseus patriarches, & after þe cristenynge Paule & Antonius first hermitis.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: What hight the foure waters þat renne thorow paradise?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: The on hiȝt Fison, the oþer Geon, the third hight Tigris, the fourth Effraton. Theise ben milke, hony, oyll, & wyn.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Wherfor is þe sonne red to-fore mete?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: For he wot not yf he may goo abowte þe Fyrmament or nyȝt.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Where-for is þe sonne rede att eue?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: For he gōōthe toward hell.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Hoo made fyrst citees?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Mercurius the Geaunte.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: Whech ben the foure waters þat weyen the erthe?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: That on is snow, the oþer is occian waters, þe IIIde is haill, þe IIIIth is dewe.

SP.SPEAKER: C.:
SP.P: How fele langages ben þer?

SP.SPEAKER: M.:
SP.P: Sixti (!) and two: & so fele disciples had god with-owte his appostels.
